predicate.note: Frames file for 'serve' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No access to verbnet at the moment. Comparison to 'work'. This completely ignored Chris' frames file. How 'bout that.

example.name: just employer
example.text: Each new trading roadblock is likely to be beaten by institutions seeking better ways *trace* to serve their high-volume clients, here or overseas.

example.name: just job
example.text: Mr. Reupke was one of three executives on Reuters's eight-person executive committee who didn't also serve on the company's board of directors.

example.name: job and employer
example.text: He has never met Lynn Williams, the president of the United Steelworkers union, and isn't active in the industry's main trade group, the American Iron and Steel Institute, which Mr. Roderick served *trace* as chairman.
example.arg: *trace* -> which -> the American Iron and Steel Institute

example.name: job as pro-controlled S
example.text: In a statement, Arnold B. McKinnon, chairman and chief executive officer, noted that the new repurchase program ``should serve to enhance shareholder value.''

example.name: breakfast in bed
example.text: John served runny eggs and burnt toast to Mary.

example.name: unmentioned beneficiary
example.text: [*-2] Served [*-1] up as a solo, however, the music lacks the resonance provided by a context within another medium.
